Cerulean Cave

Access to:
Exit on 1F: Cerulean City

Utility:
Surf is required to access and navigate this area.

Access to:
Exit on 1F: Cerulean City

Utility:
Surf is required to access and navigate this area.

Access to:
Exit on 1F: Cerulean City

Utility:
Surf is required to access and navigate this area. Wild Pokémon can also be encountered here with Surf.
Rock Smash is required to access an Ultra Ball, a Full Restore, and a PP Up. Wild Pokémon can also be encountered here with Rock Smash.

Access to:
Exit on 1F: Cerulean City

Utility:
Surf is required to access and navigate this area. Wild Pokémon can also be encountered here with Surf.
Rock Smash is required to access TM24 Thunderbolt and an Odd Incense. Wild Pokémon and random items can also be found here with Rock Smash.
Rock Climb is required to access a Dusk Stone and an Electirizer.

Access to:
Exit on 1F: Cerulean City

Utility:
Sea Skim is required to access and navigate this area. Wild Pokémon can also be encountered here with Sea Skim.

Choose display option for Pokémon tables:

Pokémon

  • Wild Parasect have a 50% chance of holding a Tinymushroom and a 5% chance of holding a Big Mushroom.
  • Wild Magneton have a 5% chance of holding a Magnet.
  • Wild Ditto have a 5% chance of holding Metal Powder.
  • Wild Machoke have a 5% chance of holding a Focus Band.
  • Wild Kadabra have a 5% chance of holding a Twistedspoon.
  • Wild Graveler have a 5% chance of holding a Hard Stone.

Pokémon

  • Wild Parasect have a 50% chance of holding a TinyMushroom and a 5% chance of holding a Big Mushroom.
  • Wild Bronzor and Magneton have a 5% chance of holding a Metal Coat.
  • Wild Primeape have a 5% chance of holding a Payapa Berry.
  • Wild Persian have a 5% chance of holding a Quick Claw.
  • Wild Chingling have a 5% chance of holding a Colbur Berry.
  • Wild Ditto have a 50% chance of holding Quick Powder and a 5% chance of holding Metal Powder.
  • Wild Kadabra have a 5% chance of holding a TwistedSpoon.
  • Wild Geodude and Graveler have a 5% chance of holding an Everstone.
  • Wild Poliwhirl have a 5% chance of holding a King's Rock.

Walking Pokémon

Walking Water-type Pokémon can find Pearls, Big Pearls, or Heart Scales at the edge of the pool of water on B1F.

Walking Pokémon can find Pearls or Big Pearls in the following locations:

  • 1F, from a glowing spot near the western ladder to 2F
  • 2F, from a glowing spot west of the large crystal at the center

Walking Pokémon can find Stardust or Star Pieces in the following locations:

  • 2F, from a glowing spot in the northeast
  • B1F, from a glowing spot northeast of the central plateau

Randomly Determined Items

The following hidden items can be found from eleven glowing spots on 2F:

Poké Ball Great Ball Ultra Ball
Ultra Balls (10x) Master Ball Golden Razz Berry
Golden Nanab Berry Golden Pinap Berry

The following hidden items can be found in front of the large crystal on 2F: Max Revives, Dome Fossils, Helix Fossils, or Old Ambers.

The following hidden items can be found on the plateau east of Mewtwo's plateau on B1F: Dome Fossils, Helix Fossils, or Old Ambers.
